Notes.Text:
This update for libcares2 fixes the following issues:

- CVE-2024-25629: Fixed out of bounds read in ares__read_line() (bsc#1220279).
Notes.Title: Details

Notes.Text: The CVRF data is provided by SUSE under the Creative Commons License 4.0 with Attribution (CC-BY-4.0).
Notes.Title: Terms of Use

Relationships.RelatesToProductReference: SUSE Linux Enterprise Server for SAP Applications 12 SP5
SUSE Linux Enterprise Software Development Kit 12 SP5
SUSE Linux Enterprise Workstation Extension 12 SP5

Vulnerabilities.Description: c-ares is a C library for asynchronous DNS requests. `ares__read_line()` is used to parse local configuration files such as `/etc/resolv.conf`, `/etc/nsswitch.conf`, the `HOSTALIASES` file, and if using a c-ares version prior to 1.27.0, the `/etc/hosts` file. If any of these configuration files has an embedded `NULL` character as the first character in a new line, it can lead to attempting to read memory prior to the start of the given buffer which may result in a crash. This issue is fixed in c-ares 1.27.0. No known workarounds exist.

ProductID: SUSE Linux Enterprise Server for SAP Applications 12 SP5:libcares2-1.9.1-9.21.1
